result.execSummary:
The defendant Theron J Haas was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged or terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of any restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  If the defendant is placed on probation or released to extended supervision, IT IS ORDERED that the defendant pay supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.

If agent recommends, defendant must attend and successfully complete an alcohol assessment and comply with any recommended treatment.  Defendant is to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance.

Defendant to be subject to random testing by his agent.

If agent recommends, defendant must attend and successfully complete a drug assessment, and comply with any recommended treatment.  Defendant to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance.

Defendant to be subject to random testing by his agent.

Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, the bar areas of restaurants. Defendant may not possess or consume any alcohol, nor be anywhere alcohol is available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.

Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.

Defendant  shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, or by any other means with M.J., unless his agent approves and she requests, and then only for the purposes of child placement issues.  

No contact with his children; the victim,  D.H., or T.H, Jr., A.T.H. and R.A.H., unless all of the following approve:  his agent, his social worker, and A.T.H.

The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.

Court advised defendant of the DNA submission requirement.

Comply and follow through with his current mental health treatment with the V.A., and not to terminate the treatment without his agent's approval.  Submit to a mental health evaluation, if his agent recommends.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
ADA Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Ritland.  Victim notification complied with.  Plead to Count 1 15CF203, amended without use of a dangerous weapon. 15CM150, Count 2.  Domestic DC.  Balance of counts  in 15CF203 and 15CM150, as well as all counts in 16CF94 and 15CM72 are dismissed, but read in for sentencing purposes.  Defense waived the reading of the amended information filed in 15CF203.  Defendant plead no contest.  Court recited the charge and possible penalties on the counts he plead to.  Defendant understood.  Felony warnings given to the defendant by the Court.  Court reviewed the plea questionnaire, constitutional rights and elements with the defendant.  Defense and defendant stipulated that there is a factual basis for the pleas.   Court found that the defendant freely, voluntarily, knowingly and intelligently entered his pleas and waived his constitutional rights.  Court found that a factual basis exists for the pleas.  Found guilty of Substantial Battery in 15CF203, contrary to 940.19(2) and Domestic Disorderly Conduct in 15CM150, contrary to 947.01(1) and 968.075(1)(a)1.  Joint recommendation for:  probation, 3 years.  No contact witth the victims, including his child. M.J., unless his agent approves and she requests.  No contact with his other children, unless approved by his agent and  his social worker.  D.H., T.H., Jr.,  ATH, RAH.  Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, the bar areas of restaurants. Defendant may not possess or consume any alcohol, nor be anywhere alcohol is available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.  AODA and recommended treatment.    The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  Submit to a mental health evaluation, if his agent recommends.  Comply with current mental health treatment and not to terminate without his agent's approval.   DNA sample and surcharge.  

Court ordered:  sentence withheld, 3 year probation, concurrent.   No contact witth the victims, including his child, D.H. No contact with M.J., unless his agent approves, only for the purposes of child placement,  and she requests.  No contact with his other children ( T.H., Jr.,  ATH, RAH.), unless approved by his agent, his social worker and A.H.    Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, the bar areas of restaurants. Defendant may not possess or consume any alcohol, nor be anywhere alcohol is available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.    Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion. AODA and recommended treatment.  Defendant to be subject to random testing by his agent.  The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  Submit to a mental health evaluation, if his agent recommends.  Comply and follow through with current mental health treatment with the VA, and not to terminate without his agent's approval.  CC, DNA sample and surcharge.    Court advised defendant of the DNA submission requirement.

No appearance by defendant at 9:30.  Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  Warrant authorized and cash bond ordered forfeited.  Defendant appears at 10:30 without counsel.  He explains he didn't appear earlier as he was at the USPO updating his mailing address.  Judge reinstates the cash bond and vacates bond forfeiture.  He states he couldn't get in contact with attorney Ritland.  He has retained him. Adjourned to 11-30-15 at 9:30.
Sent handwritten letter with ex parte letter back to defendant.  (Actually put in envelope with NOH for AIA 11-30 as it hadn't gone out in mail yet.)

Until further order of the court, you shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, except through your attorney, with any of the following individuals and/or businesses: D. H.   Defendant shall not consume any alcohol unless a physician states in writing that the defendant is alcohol dependent and complete withdrawal could endanger the defendant's health or life. In this case a doctor's excuse must be submitted to the Jackson County Clerk of Court or the Jackson County Jail within 48 hours of the bond being signed. Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, bar areas of restaurants, or where available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.  As a condition of your release, you must be available 24 hours per day, 7 days a week to submit to testing for alcohol when requested by a law enforcement officer or your probation agent. The defendant may submit to an alcohol test at the Jackson County Sheriff's Office or submit to a PBT by a law enforcement officer. Upon request, the defendant shall appear for and submit to testing within two (2) hours of the official's request. If he posts money he is to notify the clerk of courts office w/in 24 hours his mailing address.
defendant appeared VTC thru JASO

H.; he must provide the clerk of courts office of his mailing address w/in 24 hours of posting bond. AIA set for 11/23/15 @ 9:30 a.m.

In this case a doctor's excuse must be submitted to the Jackson County Clerk of Court or the Jackson County Jail within 48 hours of the bond being signed. Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, bar areas of restaurants, or where available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.
